CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively. The less balanced carrier transport in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film accounts for the lower FF. The polymers and polymer blend films were also analyzed by X-ray diffraction ( XRD ) studies. Figure 8 shows the XRD patterns of the polymers and the polymer : PC 70 BM blends. All film XRD results were similar and showed weak crystalline features with a broad peak around 23 ° . The crystalline features corresponding to π-stacking among the conjugated polymer backbones were also observed among TT - based polymers ; 25 however , the peaks were broader , and no crystalline peaks were observed at smaller angles around 4.4 ° . This less crystalline feature was possibly caused by the more twisted polymer backbones , as compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones . In conclusion , we synthesized the low band gap POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers that consist of dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The DTPD acceptor moieties allow the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers to have a low band gap ( ∼ 900 nm ) and optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs , yielding the PCEs of 4.7 and 5.3% , respectively. In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. POBDTPD (mentioned twice)
2. PEBDTPD (mentioned twice)
3. PC 70 BM (mentioned once)
4. PTB7 (mentioned once)
5. PBDTTPD (mentioned once)

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. POBDTPD
2. PEBDTPD
3. PC 70 BM
4. PTB7
5. PBDTTPD
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph after removing the irrelevant entities:

1. POBDTPD
2. PEBDTPD

So, the two "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. POBDTPD
2. PEBDTPD

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively. The less balanced carrier transport in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film accounts for the lower FF. The polymers and polymer blend films were also analyzed by X-ray diffraction ( XRD ) studies. Figure 8 shows the XRD patterns of the polymers and the polymer : PC 70 BM blends. All film XRD results were similar and showed weak crystalline features with a broad peak around 23 ° . The crystalline features corresponding to π-stacking among the conjugated polymer backbones were also observed among TT - based polymers ; 25 however , the peaks were broader , and no crystalline peaks were observed at smaller angles around 4.4 ° . This less crystalline feature was possibly caused by the more twisted polymer backbones , as compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones . In conclusion , we synthesized the low band gap POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers that consist of dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The DTPD acceptor moieties allow the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers to have a low band gap ( ∼ 900 nm ) and optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs , yielding the PCEs of 4.7 and 5.3% , respectively. In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. POBDTPD (Poly(dialkoxybenzodithiophene))
2. PEBDTPD (Poly(N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione))
3. PC 70 BM (Poly(ethylene-co-butadiene))
4. PTB7 (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
5. PBDTTPD (Poly(N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione-co-benzodithiophene))
6. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital)
7. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital)
8. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to Property Name of Material in the given paragraph:

1. POBDTPD (Poly(dialkoxybenzodithiophene))
2. PEBDTPD (Poly(N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione))
3. PC 70 BM (Poly(ethylene-co-butadiene))

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratios between the hole and electron mobilities were calculated to be 3.2 and 13.6 for the POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend and the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend films , respectively. The less balanced carrier transport in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film accounts for the lower FF. The polymers and polymer blend films were also analyzed by X-ray diffraction ( XRD ) studies. Figure 8 shows the XRD patterns of the polymers and the polymer : PC 70 BM blends. All film XRD results were similar and showed weak crystalline features with a broad peak around 23 ° . The crystalline features corresponding to π-stacking among the conjugated polymer backbones were also observed among TT - based polymers ; 25 however , the peaks were broader , and no crystalline peaks were observed at smaller angles around 4.4 ° . This less crystalline feature was possibly caused by the more twisted polymer backbones , as compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones . In conclusion , we synthesized the low band gap POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers that consist of dialkoxybenzodithiophene ( BDT ) as the donor and N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5azacyclopenta[a]pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ) as the acceptor. The DTPD acceptor moieties allow the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers to have a low band gap ( ∼ 900 nm ) and optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs , yielding the PCEs of 4.7 and 5.3% , respectively. In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Hole mobility:
The hole mobility of POBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film was calculated to be 3.2.
2. Electron mobility:
The electron mobility of PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film was calculated to be 13.6.
3. Crystalline feature peak angle:
The crystalline feature peak angle for the polymers and polymer blends was observed to be around 23°.
4. Crystalline feature broadening:
The crystalline features corresponding to π-stacking among the conjugated polymer backbones were observed to be broader in the PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blend film compared to PTB7 or PBDTTPD polymer backbones.
5. Band gap:
The band gap of POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers was calculated to be around 900 nm.
6. HOMO and LUMO levels alignment:
The DTPD acceptor moieties allow the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers to have a low band gap and optimal HOMO and LUMO levels alignment for PSCs, yielding the PCEs of 4.7 and 5.3%, respectively.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
